name: Harry SMITH and Nancy Smith, Appellees, v. CITY OF CHESTER and Delaware County Regional Water Authority, Appellants

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDermott, zappala and papadakos, jj.
ZAPPALA, J., dissents and would reach the merits of the case.
parties: Harry SMITH and Nancy Smith, Appellees, v. CITY OF CHESTER and Delaware County Regional Water Authority, Appellants.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
This appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
ZAPPALA, J., dissents and would reach the merits of the case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Nicholas S. Lippincott, Media, for appellants.
Lawrence D. Finney, Philadelphia, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
537 A.2d 812
Harry SMITH and Nancy Smith, Appellees, v. CITY OF CHESTER and Delaware County Regional Water Authority, Appellants.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Dec. 9, 1987.
Decided Feb. 26, 1988.
Nicholas S. Lippincott, Media, for appellants.
Lawrence D. Finney, Philadelphia, for appellees.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDermott, zappala and papadakos, jj.
